properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 1 at 2:40PM MST until February 3 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM MOVING IN SUNDAY MORNING...

.A low pressure system and accompanying cold front will bring snow
to the region starting tonight and continuing into Sunday night.
Areas along the Nevada border will see snow and blowing snow which
will impact travel. The snow will taper off from west to east
late Sunday, lingering across southwest Idaho highlands into
Monday morning.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches,
except 3 to 6 inches over the mountains. Winds gusting as high
as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Twin Falls County zone.

* WHEN...From 11 AM Sunday to 5 AM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow
could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM MST MONDAY
